headline: Make-Ahead Mashed Potatoes
description: These make-ahead mashed potatoes are deliciously rich thanks to the addition of cream cheese and sour cream. Simply heat through when ready to serve!

video.description: Make the holidays easier on yourself with mashers you make ahead of time.
video.name: Make-Ahead Mashed Potatoes

name: Make-Ahead Mashed Potatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Place potatoes in a large pot of lightly salted water. Bring to a boil and cook until tender, about 15 minutes; drain.
Transfer potatoes into a large bowl and mash. Stir in sour cream, cream cheese, milk, onion salt, and pepper until well combined. Transfer into a large casserole dish.
Let potatoes cool completely, 15 to 20 minutes. Cover with aluminum foil and refrigerate for up to 2 days.
When ready to bake, remove casserole from the refrigerator and let sit for 30 minutes on the counter. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Bake, covered, in the preheated oven for 50 minutes.

review.reviewBody: These potatoes are easy to make one or two days ahead of time and reheat well in the crockpot. They have become a family tradition for Thanksgiving. My son asks me when I'm going to make those Thanksgiving potatoes again. I double the recipe for 20 people. There aren't many leftovers.

I served these potatoes as a side to beef tenderloin for Christmas Eve dinner, and they got rave reviews. After mashing the potatoes and adding all the ingredients, I placed everything in a buttered crock pot and refrigerated it over night. The next morning, all I had to do was plug in the slow cooker and set to low. Simple and absolutely delicious! (I skipped the baking step.)
Very tasty and easy to make. I recruited a daughter to help with peeling and chopping potatoes. Followed recipe as written except omitted chives. Will make again!

I have made these and everyone loves them. The only difference instead of onion powder I use chopped onions. I saute the onions in butter and add that to the mix. Great flavor. I put in the crock pot to reheat. Put a towel between the pot and the lid in the crockpot to catch all the steam/water so you don't water them down.

Outstanding! This really is an exceptional recipe, the tastiest mashed potatoes Ever!!! I covered it with a glass lid, after reading reviews, and although visually it looked dry when done cooking, it most definitely was not, it was moist & delicious!! This is the only recipe I'll ever use now for mashed potatoes!

Made for the first time yesterday for Christmas. This is a keeper. Halfed the recipe. Added garlic to the potatoes as they boiled, then mashed the garlic with the potatoes. Made them a day ahead . Didn’t bake in oven. Placed in slow cooker at low setting and from time to time added a little milk. Came out wonderfully creamy. Great recipe.
I'm not a highly skilled cook. This was easy and came out great! I used less onion powder than specified (half) and it's still really tasty. Two thumbs up!
I will never make mashed potatoes the old fashioned way again. I did add a stick of butter and garlic salt instead of onion salt. Also peeled the potatoes before cooking. Delicious.
The bomb.com made it just as written and it was perfect.

AMAZING. Made this, on a whim, for Thanksgiving dinner this year. Peeled, cubed, cooked, mashed, and baked the potatoes on Monday and Tuesday, then put them in the fridge till Thursday morning. Part went in the Crock-Pot at 8:30am on low for about 4-5 hours, part was in the oven around 11:15am for roughly 45 minutes. Stirred it up a bit and brought everything to Thanksgiving dinner. Rave reviews from everyone!! Thanks for an awesome recipe!!

These are amazing! I made a half batch the day before Thanksgiving (followed recipe exactly) and we were not disappointed! So good and this year, I had all the food made the day before and just warmed it all up. Will make this a staple!

Absolutely fabulous. I didn’t have onion salt so I used 1 part onion powder and 2 parts salt. It was the best side at thanksgiving. I did make them the night before and put in crock pot to save oven room.
Not sure why I had to bake it, but added two tablespoons of butter and came out nice and lumpy and balanced; just the way I like it!

I made and served them immediately. I did not bake them at all, but I did warm all the ingredients besides potatoes in a small saucepan while the potatoes boiled. So everything was warm when added to the potatoes. Like others suggested, I added about 5 T. of butter to the mix. Mmm.
Winner-winner. Had them at Thanksgiving. Daughter (who is generally not a fan of anything other than Skittles) wanted to know how soon we could have them again.

I make these for big events and freeze them in ice cream pails. Thaw, stir and put into casserole dishes or foil pans and cook according to size.
I add a 1/2 cup of butter and use onion powder instead of onion salt, then add salt and pepper to taste. Always a big hit!
A definite time-saver! And ohhhh so good! I put dollops of butter along the top when baking. Make sure to cover with foil when baking.
The addition of cream cheese keeps the color and texture appealing. Making the potatoes ahead of time allows the cook to concentrate on other last minute preparations.
Easy. Great idea to use slow cooker. crowd loved them.

Extremely creamy. I think most people would like this as is; I would make again but would use half the cream cheese. I would prefer the potato taste to be more dominant over the cream cheese and sour cream.
Delish! Creamiest mashed potatoes ever.

These potatoes are delicious. Followed the recipe. Prepared them to take to an event and not know if gravy would be provided, so potatoes had to stand alone. Received rave reviews. Taste is similar to fully loaded baked potatoes. Good with or without gravy. Family is having them for Thanksgiving.
I have done this recipe so many times, and every time it turns out great I serve them with BBQ ribs and my family loves it. Thank you!!!

These mashed potatoes were a big hit at a family dinner. And what a lifesaver being able to make it ahead! They definitely tasted freshly mashed and delicious. I made according to recipe and heated in the oven according to recipe and they came out just right.
I made these for a mystery dinner guest party. Huge hit!
Make ahead mashed potatoes are a great way to prepare for a big dinner get together. I had a dinner for 45 people. I kept these potatoes warm in a crock pot. Very tasty too.

Great. Don't overcook the potatoes, or it will be difficult to separate them from the water. Mine were a bit wet, so I baked the finished casserole in the oven without a lid, to dry then out a bit. I used a stand mixer to thoroughly mix the sour cream, cream cheese, and 1/2 cup butter. Then I manually mashed and stirred in the potatoes. Don't mix the potatoes with the mixer, as that produces too much gluten and will make the potatoes sticky/stretchy. I did not add milk, having used butter instead. I was in a rush and timed myself, starting from nonwashed whole potatoes to ready to serve dish, did take a full 1hr 20 min. I did not peel my red potatoes.
What a great time time saver! The potatoes tasted amazing as leftovers as well. Yummo!
Will never make mashed potatoes for a crowd any other way. They were deliciously easy!

After my daughter-in-law shared this is now my go-to potato recipe! Have made it multiple times. Terrific in the crock pot to serve as a Mashed Potato Bar! Used Christmas stemware; provided multiple toppings.
great recipe, I made it several days before Thanksgiving and that day heated in a low temp. crock pot for about 6 hours. What a great time saver that day. Thanks Carol for this great recipe

Absolutely the best mashed potatoes we have ever made. I made them a day ahead, put them overnight in my refrigerator, and put them in the slow cooker the next morning. All I had to do was stir them a couple of times. I will always make mashed potatoes using this recipe.

This is a great recipe especially for a meal where you have a lot to do at the last moment. We just used it for Thanksgiving and my husband is already requesting it for whenever I make mashed potatoes. I made it as written, but didn't have onion salt, so just added onion powder and salt. Everyone raved about it. I will definitely be making it again.
I've made these for Thanksgiving the last three years and everyone raves how good they are. The best part is they're done ahead of time so you can enjoy more time with family.

The 15 lbs of potatoes I made in to this recipe are now in the compost, and undoubtedly the dirt produced by them will taste better than these sour, inedible things. We had to replace them with bob Evans microwave potatoes....on Thanksgiving.....Whomever gave this recipe 5 stars have to be bots
Great! Made it Tuesday before Thanksgiving — cooked in crockpot for 4.5 hours on low - stirred once halfway thru.

This is a great recipe, used it today (day before Thanksgiving!) for the first time as a make-ahead. I used Idaho/Russet potatoes instead of Yukon, peeled and cut them into cubes, then left them in a bowl of water for 10-15 min. After boiling, I added the ingredients as listed, but this really needed butter to give that extra boost in flavor. I mixed in about half a stick and tasted great, so I put it in the fridge. Will take out tomorrow to bake!

I make these often now as it is so convenient to be able to do them ahead of time. The only thing they are missing as written is the butter. Gotta have butter in mashed potatoes. I use a whole stick. Takes lots of salt and pepper to get to the right place. I'm giving recipe a 4 as written. It is a 5 with the stick of better and plenty of salt and pepper.
Are these potatoes good with gravy?

I really enjoyed this recipe. I used small gold thin-skinned potatoes and left the skins on. Great flavor and reheated nicely the next day. I’m making it again for the holidays and will reheat in a slow cooker.

I’ve made this recipe for Thanksgiving for years. It gets rave reviews and is now a staple on my holiday table. I make it a day or two ahead and then let it come to room temperature before I heat it. It’s a lot of potatoes and takes a long time to heat all the way through. I learned that lesson the first time I made it!
Love Loved it!!!!
I made it once for a family gathering and then had to share the recipe with 2 guests.
Delicious! I didn’t change a thing!
Very Good !!!!

I have made this several times at Thanksgiving. I can make a day or two ahead. Thanksgiving morning I just take the potatoes out of the fridge, put in the crock pot and turn on low heat. By 2 pm dinner time these are ready to go.

They do have a bit of a cream cheese flavor. There is another Make Ahead Mashed Potato recipe on this site with not as many reviews without cream cheese that I may try next time.
I made these early the morning and put them in the crock pot on low about 4 hours before dinner. No leftovers!

I have made a variation on these potatoes for many years. Once substituted regular yogurt for sour cream - not a good idea.
Now wondering if anyone has tried using the Greek yogurt in place of sour cream - I am using this substitution in many other recipes with great results and lower calories.

This is my go-to recipe for make ahead mashed potatoes. I've made them for holiday meals for the past several years. I use 6 pounds of potatoes since that fills my casserole dish better. I only alter the milk if they look dry. I typically use half russet potatoes because they're bigger and I dislike peeling the potatoes. I haven't noticed any great change in taste. 
If you refrigerate overnight, definitely pull out of fridge early before cooking- I've had to microwave them because the rest of the meal was ready, but the potatoes were still cold.
Beware!...too good. Tastes like the best loaded baked potato. Not a spoonful left!

No I made it exactly as the recipe said and would do it again in the same fashion. I made them for Thanksgiving & everyone loved them. My 8 yr old granddaughter asked me if she could have ALL the leftovers!!

Made these for Thanksgiving... they were a huge hit with my entire family, everyone loved them!!!! Easy to make (followed recipe exactly), will definitely make again.
Made again for xmas 2018 - did not peel potatoes and worked fine (even easier!).
This is the BEST make ahead recipe I have found but the onion salt MUST be omitted! Once that is gone, the taste is wonderful! Best part is that no one knows that they were made ahead of time!

These are the potatoes we make every year 
Make ahead, put in zip lock baggies, flatten them out and stack in refrigerator. We make at least 30 pounds. Great to make , up to a week ahead. We always reheat in buttered crock pot( 4 hrs) stir occasionally.

This is so easy and so delicious. It is the only way I will make mashed potatoes in the future for guests. I added chapped fresh chives to give it color and flavor we like. It looked beautiful and tasted great. I cut the recipe in half and it served 6 easily. Try it you will love it!
I have made this recipe for years. No sour cream, but butter and cream cheese. I cook my potatoes in chicken bouillon for extra flavor!

I make these year round. It's a very flexible recipe, I sometimes switch the sour cream with greek yogurt, use part cream cheese, part other cheeses like cheddar , Italina blend - whatever is on hand. also skip the sour cream and use cottage cheese sometimes. I season as I would for freshkly made .

This is awesome! The first time I made it, I couldn't find my onion powder, so I used garlic powder instead - and have made it multiple times that way ever since. I'm sure it tastes great with onion powder, but just so other cooks know - you can substitute garlic powder if you want.
Huge time saver and they reheat great.
I am always leary of preparing mashed potatoes ahead of time and reheating. This recipe is absolutely delicious!!!
Came out perfect minus the cream cheese and used half and half instead of milk with a few sprinkles of onion seasoning.
Hi make this all the time but use light garlic & herb cream cheese instead of plain.
these are absolutely amazing! i make them for holidays and my family loves it! I throw it in the Kitchenaid mixer and it makes the mashing and mixing process sooo easy!

Made this dish two days before Thanksgiving. Absolutely wonderful! No last minute stress or mess to clean up. I reheated in my crockpot. Had to thin a bit with milk. I'mean making them again next week.

I followed the recipe exactly, but doubled it. It served 16 people with leftovers. Made it the day before thanksgiving and heated it up in the crockpot for 4 hours on low before serving. Potatoes were piping hot, fluffy and creamy. Will make again.
Turned out great, the family loved them and making them the day before made Thanksgiving less stressful.
No changes and it was an awesome recipe! Loved the make ahead option and flavors were wonderful! Moist and creamy.

Best ever make ahead recipe -- the crock pot full of warm potatoes will make my Thanksgiving a LOT easier with only one oven. I added more spices but we like spices here. The freeze the leftover mashed potatoes idea on a review will save me a TON of time making Shepards pie or when making a pot roast - potatoes will already be done and real ones!

Excellent and easy make-ahead recipe! I used russet potatoes, 1 8 oz. pack of cream cheese, onion powder + salt instead of the onion salt and garlic powder. Made a day ahead and heated for a couple hours in the crockpot with some butter toward the end. Creamy and delicious. Everyone loved it!
They are a little dry, butter on top makes them ok. Makes enough to freeze.

I love these mashed potatoes. I make them every Thanksgiving, and I also bring them if going to a Thanksgiving potluck. You can make them even 2-3 days ahead and they taste great, but I normally make them the night before...saves a bunch of time for cooking other Thanksgiving food. For potlucks, I bring them in a slow cooker...just warm them up with a half stick of butter on top.
I make this the night before, sparing me up to make all the other dishes...what a time saver and just as delicious.
Everyone loves these mashed potatoes! Can't go wrong with this recipe!
I did not care for these as the cream cheese and sour cream overpowered the taste of the potatoes, in my opinion. My husband, however, really liked them.

The best mashed potatoes I have ever made... I made a ten pound batch of these....used the slow cooker with pats of butter on top a little milk as suggested, slow cooked it for five hours, nothing but compliments....thanks

These were delicious & easy. Made these for Thanksgiving, but they will be a regular at my house, we love mashed potatoes! I followed the recipe exactly, except I used russet potatoes, & instead of baking in the oven I put them in my crock pot on low for a few hours. I used a crock pot liner for easy clean up

I basically eye-balled everything but the ingredients themselves were used. Only change was to use chopped chives in place of the onion powder. I prepared the dish the night before thanksgiving and baked the next day. This was so convenient, they tasted great, and I popped it into the oven while my turkey was resting. I could easily see how this could be made ahead then placed in small serving bowls and frozen for a quick dinner. Thanks for this great recipe.

Excellent recipe! I only used 1 (8 oz) brick of cream cheese and added minced garlic. I didn't have any onion powder but I did add some chopped, fresh chives instead. Very creamy and delicious. I also had about a 1/2 cup of chicken broth that I was looking to get rid of and rather than pouring it down the sink, I added it to the potatoes. I made the morning of Thanksgiving and put into a crock pot and kept in the refrigerator until about 4 hours before we are planning to eat.
These are slimy and tasteless.

Very good and it made it so much easier to do ahead of time. I also threw it in the blender with some half and half to make them smooth and creamy. Reheated them in the crockpot with a stick of butter for 3 hours. Yumm

My mother-in-law, who is known to many as a fabulous cook, has been making this recipe for years. She also adds 2 Tbsp butter and sometimes shredded cheddar cheese on top. I like to put in crockpot for 3 hours on low.

Made this for Christmas and Thanksgiving last year. I added minced garlic. Was to die for. Also left some potatoes unpeeled gave added texture the first time. Second time around I used red potatoes, that was the prefered batch.

I made this recipe last year and it was a hit. I made the day before Thanksgiving and stored in my crockpot in the refrigerator overnight. Took out in the morning and turned the crockpot on low for about an hour, gave a good stir and then up to high for an hour and then back to low and the potatoes were perfectly heated and fluffy for our 1:00 p.m. dinner. I will definitely make again this year. I highly recommend using Yukon Gold even though they are more expensive and leave the skin on. The only other change - I may have added a couple teaspoons garlic salt. And also you must use a potato masher and not your mixer. Save the mixer for dessert!!

This is delicious and perfect for make ahead meals. The whole family loved it. My picky grandson even went back for seconds. I used minced garlic in place of onion salt & used an 8 oz brick of reduced fat cream cheese instead of 6 oz. I didn't measure anything & it turned out great. I mixed it all in my Kitchen Aid stand mixer mixing potatoes & milk on low. I scraped down the sides & added remaining ingredients. Scrape down again then mix it on high for a smooth consistency. These are thick potatoes that reheat very well in microwave or crock pot.
Very Very Very Good !!!! I did not bake either.
All oved this dish

My husband was so nervous about this recipe! He really likes his mashed potatoes and thought I would ruin Thanksgiving dinner with a preposterous make ahead mashed potato recipe :)........He and everyone else loved them. After reading reviewers recommendations, I made the recipe as is, put them in a crock pot on low 2 hours before dinner, put a stick of butter on top to melt 30 minutes before serving. This recipe was a great time saver on a hectic Holiday morning. I will definitely make this again for special occasions. Thanks so much!
These potatoes are SO good! They are perfect for potlucks! I made this dish for a potluck and everyone LOVED it! I will definitely be using this recipe again!
they were delicious. very moist and tasty,

I have made this twice now, the first time exactly as is, the second time I substituted butter for the sour cream and milk and garlic salt for the onion salt. (That was all I had on hand) Both times were great, but the original is best.
Theeeeeeee best mashed potatoes ever. Easy to do!!

Wonderful! These were great! I was planning a 4 pm dinner time, so I started preparing these about 1 pm. I put them in the crock pot @ 2 pm and stirred them once or twice and by 4 pm when it was time to eat (Thanksgiving Dinner) they were fabulous! The consistency was great, not runny or hard. Even left overs the next day were good. If you're reheating them after they've been cold, and they are hard, just add some milk. They're perfect every time! :-)
Best recipe yet!

OUTSTANDING! First time I ever tried "make ahead" mashed potatoes, and not only were they delicious, it saved so much time and oven space (I heated them in the crock pot.) Everyone loved them. This is a KEEPER! Thanks for sharing this recipe!

I made these the day before Thanksgiving and put them in my slow cooker on low for about 4 hours before the dinner. They were thick and goopy...very disappointed. Sorry, but I can't waste my money on this recipe again.

Great recipe!! Tasted amazing! Never made overnight mashed potatoes before, so I was a little cautious and followed original recipe. Turned out great! I will definately make this again.Saved me a lot of time on Thanksgiving Day....
Why, oh, why has it taken me so long to try this dish? Stellar results. I'm never going to rush around mashing the potatoes at the last minute again.

These are easy I've made than the last two years! I preferred to go very easy on the garlic salt and instead use regular salt. Make them ahead and throw them in the crockpot with some extra milk to heat up on Thanksgiving day.
really easy and so creamy.
